Detailed Local Forecast

How to Read This
  • Tonight: Partly cloudy. Low 48F. Winds light and variable.
  • Tomorrow: Except for a few afternoon clouds, mainly sunny. High around 75F. Winds light and variable.
  • Tomorrow night: Mostly cloudy skies. Low 52F. Winds light and variable.
  • Sunday: Morning clouds will give way to sunshine for the afternoon. High 67F. Winds W at 5 to 10 mph.
  • Monday: Morning clouds followed by afternoon sun. Highs in the upper 60s and lows in the low 50s.
  • Tuesday: Mix of sun and clouds. Highs in the mid 60s and lows in the mid 40s.

Storms kill 5 Mexicans; thousands of homes flooded

AP-Thu, 25 Sep 2008 21:22:05 PDT

AP - Storms flooded hundreds of people out of their homes in southeastern Mexico and caused the death of a woman and four children whose car plunged into a swollen irrigation ditch.

  • 14 dead from heavy rain in southwest China AP - Thu, 25 Sep 2008 20:40:18 PDT

    AP - Flash floods and landslides unleashed by heavy rains have killed 14 people in one of the areas hit hardest by the massive May 12 earthquake in China's Sichuan province, the official Xinhua news agency said.

  • Tropical Storm Kyle strengthens in open Atlantic AP - Thu, 25 Sep 2008 20:13:11 PDT

    AP - The National Hurricane Center says Tropical Storm Kyle has strengthened as it churns through the open Atlantic, south of Bermuda.

  • Tropical Storm Kyle forms in Atlantic Reuters - Thu, 25 Sep 2008 13:52:38 PDT

    Reuters - Tropical Storm Kyle, the 11th of the 2008 Atlantic hurricane season, formed on Thursday in the Atlantic Ocean, the U.S. National Hurricane Center said.

  • Storms batter China, 18 killed: state media AFP - Thu, 25 Sep 2008 12:08:12 PDT

    AFP - Torrential rains left at least 18 dead in China, including a Briton, and 17 missing, as Typhoon Hagupit pounded the south and another storm battered the quake-hit southwest, state media said Thursday.
